intro: Crotalaria albida var. epunctata, commonly known as the white spurred crotalaria, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features distinctive white flowers with prominent spurred petals, and its leaves are typically trifoliate. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed sites. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
